summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 between a UK Metropolitan Police Detective Chief Superintendent and FBI Special Agents regarding 'Operation Burlington' and the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The UK police are seeking access to daily trial transcripts, information about mentions of London/UK, and trial dates to proactively monitor the case.

persons.name: Detective Chief Superintendent
persons.context: The primary UK correspondent from the Metropolitan Police's Central Specialist Crime unit, taking over the case and requesting information about the Ghislaine Maxwell trial to monitor for UK-related mentions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' in the email; her trial is the subject of the correspondence, with the prosecution having a deadline to disclose co-conspirator identities.

connections.description: The UK police officer is investigating matters related to Ghislaine Maxwell's case, specifically any UK/London connections that might arise during her trial.

events.title: Deadline for Co-conspirator Disclosure
events.description: Prosecution deadline to disclose identities of Ghislaine Maxwell's co-conspirators and their statements.

events.title: Jury Selection Week
events.description: Week scheduled for jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Trial Start Date
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Expected Trial End
events.description: The trial is expected to last until approximately this date.

keyFacts: The UK Metropolitan Police were actively monitoring the Ghislaine Maxwell trial for any mentions of London or UK matters, indicating an ongoing UK investigation linked to the case.
The prosecution had a deadline of October 11, 2021, to disclose the identities of Ghislaine Maxwell's co-conspirators and their statements.
The Maxwell trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021, and was expected to last until about December 23, 2021.
COVID-19 restrictions were expected to severely limit courtroom access during the trial, raising concerns even for law enforcement personnel attending.
The correspondence reveals coordination between the FBI's New York Field Office and the UK's Metropolitan Police regarding the sharing of trial information and transcripts.
